# speed

**Instance Property**

A factor that increases or decreases the animation’s rate of playback.

## Declaration

```swift
var speed: Float { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value is `1.0`, which doesn’t alter the animation’s duration. A value of `2.0` indicates that the duration is half the normal rate. A value of `0.5` indicates that the duration is twice the normal rate. Negative values play the animation in reverse.

This property doesn’t affect the animation’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/FromToByAnimation/delay].

## Timing the group

- **delay**: An amount of time that lapses before the animation plays.
- **duration**: The total playback time of the animation.
- **offset**: The time, in seconds, at which the animations begin within the duration.
- **trimDuration**: An optional duration that overrides the calculated duration.
- **trimStart**: The time, in seconds, at which the animations play.
- **trimEnd**: The time, in seconds, at which the animations stop.
